snippet: As the campaigns go into high gear, voters can expect a blur of ads and an endless number of unsolicited phone calls.
abstract: Both Pres Obama's and Mitt Romney's campaigns shift into high gear as the Democratic National Convention ends, marking the first real day of general election campaigning.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters reported from Sioux City, Iowa, and Helene Cooper from Iowa City.

lead_paragraph: As the campaigns go into high gear, voters can expect a blur of ads and an endless number of unsolicited phone calls.

headline.seo: Obama and Romney, Conventions Over, Hit the Road
headline.main: Race Is On in Earnest as Candidates Hit the Road
headline.print_headline: Race Is On In Earnest As Candidates Hit the Road
